$learning_note.value: In the latest update from the Royal Navy, HMS Dauntless is highlighted for its role in simulating combat scenarios by fending off drone attacks as part of preparations for the global carrier strike group mission. This mission will see Dauntless among the formidable warships and aircraft safeguarding the flagship, HMS Queen Elizabeth, as it leads the task group into the Indo-Pacific region. Wildcat attack helicopters from the 815 Naval Air Squadron also participated, successfully deploying Marlet air-to-air missiles to neutralize small, fast-moving threats. Additionally, the Royal Navy's vigilance extends to monitoring Russian survey ships in UK waters, with HMS Cattistock and HMS Somerset tracking their movements in the Channel and North Sea. For more details, watch the video here: [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PfkW_wvQ6Ac](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PfkW_wvQ6Ac).
